titleStmt.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary E. Teller. John Haynes Testimony

publicationStmt.authority: Bring Me the Body: A Digital & Print History of Marginalized Habeas Corpus Petitioners in the North American West, 1804-1912

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary E. Teller. John Haynes Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Live Deep Creek Falls Know Ms Teller knew her husband Frank Teller know he is Dead seen him lying in the ground Dead saw him here Tuesday 31st May Dead - lying in his door yard between the door and gate about 9 AM dont know whether stiff or not blood looked fresh blood on him on his left hand face and head Diagram shown to witness asked to state if correct Think this is correct Was lying between door and gate head toward gate by the fence Teller was not average height but 5 feet high Cannot tell how many feet from door to gate according to question to as to correctness about 15 feet from door to gate More than three times the length of body Think wider than this room When I got here Tuesday morning found body of Mr Teller lying in the door yard and there was double barrell shot gun lying about 3 feet or so from the body Both barrells cocked fresh caps the tubes and then a piece of a pine tree 3 foot long and 5 or 6 in wide and one in thick then some little chips and sticks and
splotches of blood in them -- blood on the gate door in between the main body and the door of the house blood in the gun on the barrell the muzzle and blood for the door on the gun and in the breech of the gun there was the blood that seemed had just splattered out on breech of the gun on the ground round where the gun lay was blood on one side and one end of the club and some hair on it chips even peices that had been chopped off a pine board of some kind and were laying between where the board lay and the door of the house Made no examination of the Dead Man - lying on his face left side up both arms extended down with fingers turned up - no one about the place when I went there got there at 9 am left 1 PM went to DC about two hours & returned premises same when I returned in afternoon know Mr Stoltz and he went with me on my second trip up from dinner remained second time two hours - dont know when he went on guard - he was on guard while I was there as
late as 7 o'clock as near as I could tell had no time piece left 7:30 oclock about that premises were just the same as in the morning R Stoltz Mr Paul and Mr Sizel and quite a number of others were there was then next day - that then about 7:30 AM premises were not the same as they were before The corner was there before me and I saw him turn the body of Teller over and the shot gun had been taken up - body had not been disturbed from the time I first saw it up to time I left in the evening of the first day

Was present next Day when Teller clothing was examined did not see a bullet - know nothing about a bullet saw Tellers body undressed saw a little bruised spot on the left side near the heart I just looked at the gun saw fresh Caps on it dont know whether it was loaded or not
Dont know whether the defendant occupied the house at time of the murder killing saw her there about a month before
Sworn and subscribed to before me this 8th day of June 1887

Territory of Washington vs Mary Teller
John Haynes

Filed June 8th 1887
Jno J Booge
Justice of the Peace
